sections.text: Mineral rights asserted, protected and defended as other immovablesThe owner of a mineral right may assert, protect, and defend his right in the same manner as the ownership or possession of other immovable property, and without the concurrence, joinder, or consent of the owner of the land or mineral rights.Amended by Acts 1974, No. 547, ยง1, eff. Jan. 1, 1975.
